entries.title: Major New Jersey paper calls Second Amendment a ‘curse,’ claims America has ‘fetish with gun culture’
entries.description: The editorial board of a major New Jersey newspaper trashed the Second Amendment, calling it a "curse" and praised countries like Canada for limiting guns.

entries.title: NFL teams switch profile pictures in honor of Bills' Damar Hamlin
entries.description: NFL teams are rallying around the Buffalo Bills and safety Damar Hamlin. Each of the 32 teams' Twitter profile pictures feature Hamlin's No. 3 jersey.

entries.title: Byron Donalds sets House floor abuzz by switching vote from McCarthy to Jordan
entries.description: Rep. Byron Donalds caused a stir in the House of Representatives on Tuesday when he switched his vote for the speaker of the chamber away from GOP Leader Kevin McCarthy.

entries.title: Jessica Simpson shares photo after finding her 8th grade cheerleading letterman jacket
entries.description: Jessica Simpson sported a letterman jacket she wore as a middle school cheerleader. Her sister, Ashlee Simpson, commented, "Go Vikings!" in response.

entries.title: Texas grandfather accused of capital murder in stabbing death of 8-year-old grandson
entries.description: A 62-year-old man in Texas is being held on a capital murder charge, accused of stabbing his 8-year-old grandson to death on New Year's Day.

entries.title: Idaho murders: PA police say 'force was used' when search warrant was executed at Kohberger home
entries.description: Pennsylvania police say "force was used" when law enforcement executed a search warrant in the arrest of Idaho murder suspect Bryan Kohberger on Dec. 30.

entries.title: Considering a cruise? High seas may be the right option for both family and wallet
entries.description: If a cruise is in your travel plans, three experts weighed in on cruise lines and cruise amenities. Tips include driving to the port and deciding what you want from a cruise vacation.

entries.title: One-time NFL MVP theorizes how league will play remaining schedule
entries.description: One-time NFL MVP and WFAN radio personality Boomer Esiason offered his theory on how the league might move forward with its schedule following the Damar Hamlin injury.

entries.title: These senators face the most trouble getting re-elected in 2024
entries.description: Democrats face an uphill battle to maintain their Senate majority in 2024, with several senators facing mounting odds if they seek re-election

entries.title: Pro-life groups rebut Trump's midterm blame: 'Nonsense,' 'Losing political strategy'
entries.description: Former President Trump blamed pro-lifers for Republican losses in the November midterm elections, but pro-life organizations said his assessment was wrong.

entries.title: Paul Gosar spotted chatting with AOC on House floor amid House speaker votes
entries.description: Reps. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, D-N.Y., and Paul Gosar, R-Ari., were spotted chatting as the House voted on multiple ballots to pick its next speaker.

entries.title: McCarthy opponent Chip Roy says he won't succumb to 'threats' from GOP colleagues: 'We won't back down'
entries.description: Rep. Chip Roy, R-Texas, defends his decision not to support Rep. Kevin McCarthy for House speaker after he fell short of the 218 votes required to take the gavel.

entries.title: Idaho murders: Bryan Kohberger seen on body camera footage during traffic stop in Indiana
entries.description: Idaho murder suspect Bryan Kohberger could be seen on body camera footage during a traffic stop on Dec. 15 in Hancock County, Indiana, about one month after four University of Idaho students were murdered.

entries.title: Cristiano Ronaldo says he's done playing in Europe: 'I won everything'
entries.description: Cristiano Ronaldo spoke during his introductory press conference with Saudi Arabia's Al Nassr FC, saying that he's done playing for Europe's best clubs because "I won everything."

entries.title: Red Sox, All-Star Rafael Devers agree on 1-year, $17.5M deal: report
entries.description: The Boston Red Sox have agreed to a one-year contract with two-time All-Star infielder Rafael Devers, which avoids salary arbitration. The deal is reportedly worth $17.5 million.

entries.title: House Democrats cheer as McCarthy fails to clinch speakership multiple times
entries.description: House Democrats cheered after Republicans failed multiple times to reach a majority to elect House Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy to the speaker position.

entries.title: Georgia police arrest alleged deputy killer
entries.description: A man is in custody for allegedly shooting and killing Fulton County Sheriff's Office Deputy James Thomas on Dec. 29, 2022. The suspect, Alton Oliver was charged with murder.

entries.title: Chinese carrier strike group, drones operating near Japan, which dispatched aircraft to monitor situation
entries.description: Chinese drones and warships have been operating near Japan in recent weeks, worrying Japanese defense officials.

entries.description: Conservatives and liberals on Twitter exploded on Tuesday after House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy repeatedly failed to be elected Speaker.

entries.title: 'Fight we must': Ron DeSantis flames Davos 'jetsetters,' 'technocratic elites' in fiery inauguration speech
entries.description: Gov. Ron DeSantis ravaged "jetsetters" and "technocratic elites" of the Davos World Economic Forum during a fiery speech following his inauguration for a second term as governor.

entries.title: Florida man who impersonated doctor as a teen gets prison time for stealing from employer
entries.description: Malachi Love-Robinson, who previously spent time in prison for impersonating a doctor as a teenager, was sentenced to 28 months last week for stealing from his employer.

entries.title: Houston police looking for robbery suspects for allegedly holding rideshare driver at gunpoint
entries.description: Houston police are looking for two suspects caught on video allegedly trying to rob a rideshare driver at gunpoint

entries.title: Florida officials release video of people being rescued from 400-foot-tall ICON park ride after it loses power

entries.title: Belgium to test wastewater on flights arriving from China for COVID
entries.description: Wastewater on planes arriving to Belgium from China will be tested for COVID-19. China is currently facing a surge in cases after lifting its "zero-COVID" policies.

entries.description: The European Union is offering free coronavirus vaccines to China as the country is facing an increase of cases after lifting its "zero-COVID" policies last year.

entries.title: Bryan Kohberger's lawyer sends defense investigators to crime scene: source
entries.description: Members of Bryan Kohberger's defense team toured the Idaho home where four college students were brutally slaughtered Nov. 13, Fox News Digital has learned.

entries.description: Take a look into the life of LeBron James throughout the years on the court, with his family, and celebrating championships. James is a record-setting basketball player.

entries.description: A murder suspect allegedly threw an object into an RV in Los Angeles, setting it ablaze near Exposition Park with a homeless man inside. The suspect remains at large.

entries.description: Rep-elect George Santos, R-NY, appeared to flee from a gaggle of reporters loitering outside his office on Capitol Hill on Tuesday. Santos is facing multiple investigations.

entries.title: Apple to raise battery service fees for out-of-warranty devices
entries.description: Apple is increasing out-of-warranty battery service fees for several of its products, including iPhones, early this year. Changes are slated to occur on March 1.

entries.title: Blinken reminds Israel Biden admin committed to 'two-state solution' following Netanyahu appointment
entries.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken reminded Israel of the Biden administration's commitment to a two-state solution with their Palestinian neighbors following the appointment of Eli Cohen as foreign minister.

entries.title: DeSantis: Soft on crime policies, 'woke ideology,' sparked 'mass exodus' to Florida from Democrat-run cities

entries.title: Kansas City suspect killed in police shooting identified

entries.title: Maryland man sentenced to prison after embezzling more than $300K from West Virginia resort
entries.description: A Maryland man was sentenced to 27 months in a West Virginia resort theft case. The man submitted fake invoices that requested reimbursement for maintenance work that never occurred.

entries.title: Minnesota senior, dog killed in New Year's Day house fire

entries.title: Syria says Israeli airstrike shut down Damascus airport, killing 2 soldiers and wounding 2 others

entries.title: Roswell zoo reopens day after 4 animals die in dog attack

entries.title: CA earthquake on New Year’s Day damages at least 20 apartments

entries.description: Buffalo Bills and Cincinnati Bengals fans joined together to show support for Damar Hamlin after he collapsed on the field Monday night during a game.

entries.title: On this day in history, Jan. 3, 1987, Aretha Franklin is first woman inducted into Rock Hall of Fame
entries.description: Aretha Franklin, Queen of Soul, was the first women inducted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame, on Jan. 3, 1987. She topped the Rolling Stone list of 200 greatest singers ever.

entries.title: Lakers' LeBron James commends NFL decision to suspend Bills-Bengals game after Damar Hamlin collapses
entries.description: Los Angeles Lakers star LeBron James praised the NFL's decision to suspend Monday's game after Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin collapsed on the field in the first quarter.

entries.title: Bills players ask for prayers as Damar Hamlin is hospitalized in critical condition after collapsing on field
entries.description: Buffalo Bills players pleaded for prayers late Monday after Damar Hamlin was taken to the hospital following a collapse on the field. He was in critical condition.

entries.title: Prayers pour in for Bills safety Damar Hamlin after collapsing on the field: 'The game is not important'
entries.description: Social media erupted into thoughts and prayers after Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin collapsed on the field during Monday night's game against the Cincinnati Bengals.

entries.title: Texas Waffle House former employee gives her side of brawl that went viral
entries.description: The Waffle House employee who was captured on video catching a chair that was chucked at her, and deflecting it to the ground gave her side of events from the night of the brawl.

entries.title: California car crash: Tesla plunges 250 feet off cliff at 'Devil's Slide'
entries.description: Four people were safely rescued from a Tesla that plunged about 250 feet off a cliff along Highway 1 at "Devil's Slide" in California, according to officials.

entries.title: Bills gather for team prayer on field following Damar Hamlin injury
entries.description: Buffalo Bills head coach Sean McDermott gathered his team for a group prayer following a terrifying scene that saw safety Damar Hamlin taken off the field in an ambulance following a scary hit.

entries.title: The new Omicron subvariant XBB.1.5: What you must know now
entries.description: The new XBB.1.5 COVID-19 mutation is popping up in new cases across the country at a concerning speed. Health experts weigh in on the latest variant of the virus.

entries.title: Bills' Damar Hamlin collapses on the field, game suspended for rest of night
entries.description: Buffalo Bills defensive back Damar Hamlin appeared to be seriously injured on a tackle on a Cincinnati Bengals wide receiver on Monday night.

entries.title: Mexican prison attack death toll up to 17, gang leader one of 25 escapees officials say
entries.description: The death toll from an attack in a Mexican prison across from Texas was raised to 17 Monday.

entries.title: Ohio State kicker misses game-winning field goal exactly as the ball drops in Times Square
entries.description: Ohio State kicker Noah Ruggles missed a 50-yard field goal attempt on Saturday night to advance to the national championship game just as the East Coast rang in the New Year.

entries.title: UFC's Dana White, wife Anne apologize after video of alcohol-fueled slapping incident surfaces
entries.description: UFC president Dana White and his wife Anna were caught on camera in the middle of a slapping incident while the two were seemingly partying for New Year's.

entries.title: Chinese travelers facing COVID-19 testing requirements from more countries amid outbreak
entries.description: At least a dozen countries have implemented testing requirements and other containment measures on Chinese travelers amid an explosive COVID-19 outbreak.

entries.title: Dollar Tree Employee murdered with machete
entries.description: A man is accused of murdering a Dollar Tree employee with a machete inside an Upper Sandusky, Ohio store on New Year’s Day.

entries.title: Ex-NFL star Boomer Esiason rips Patriots' Mac Jones over alleged 'd-----ness' body language
entries.description: New England Patriots quarterback Mac Jones faced criticism from former NFL star Boomer Esiason over his body language over the course of the 2022 season.

entries.title: Idaho murder suspect’s former student says behavior changed after slayings: ‘He seemed preoccupied'
entries.description: Bryan Kohberger, a PhD student in Washington State University’s criminal justice program, was arrested for allegedly murdering four University of Idaho students.

entries.title: Missouri could become first state to execute a transgender woman
entries.description: Missouri could become the first state to execute a transgender woman in the United States if Gov. Mark Parson does not grant a request for clemency.

entries.title: Winter Classic 2023: Bruins rally behind Jake DeBrusk's two goals, Pens' last-ditch goal waved off
entries.description: The Boston Bruins won their fourth Winter Classic on Monday after rallying behind Jake DeBrusk's two, third period goals to defeat the Pittsburgh Penguins.

entries.title: More than 60,000 come to view Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI's body on first day
entries.description: Italian police predicted 30,000 visitors to view Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI's body. By the end of the evening, 65,000 people passed through St. Peter's Basilica.

entries.title: Uche Nwaneri, former Jaguars offensive lineman, dead at 38
entries.description: Uche Nwaneri, a former NFL offensive lineman who played for the Jacksonville Jaguars, died last week in his wife's Indiana home. He was 38.
